What this moment is asking of us is to discuss *white supremacy and racism* as much - or possibly more than - *white supremacists and racists.*

When we do that, I believe we will start to make progress.

Recognizing white supremacy in ourselves - our institutions, our subconscious, our own past remarks or acts (no matter how consciously unintentional), is what makes the healing work ahead challenging.

8. This is convo is bigger than parental leave - it‚Äôs a larger conversation about how modern work has grown so hostile to family life. It doesn‚Äôt have to be that way!

7. Additionally, paying a living min wage to our most junior staffers means they‚Äôre talented + capable (no 2nd job) to take over big-time situations, meaning senior staffers are confident enough in them to take parental leave and not feel like everything will fall apart.

6. We make an effort to make our office family-friendly. We talk about what play mats + cribs we need along w/ our legislative agenda. My personal office can be used for pumping/feeding.

5. Equal pay at work is about SO much more than the salary you offer.

4. I want to reiterate how important it is to give dads full parental leave. I strongly encourage them to take the full time.

@kraigschmidt Everyone‚Äôs last names are hyphenated - so you children take the first names of each of their parents.

ex: my dad was Ocasio-ABC, my mom‚Äôs was Cortez-XYZ

So I am Ocasio-Cortez

(When they married, my mom became Ocasio-Cortez too - wives keep father‚Äôs name + take husband‚Äôs too)

For the curious, in Latinx culture children take *both* their parents‚Äò names.

It‚Äôs not a ‚Äúprogressive, new thing.‚Äù It‚Äôs just how some names work. PR hyphenates, others mark differently. Your last name = the families that came together to make you.

AOC is also fine though :)
